GENERAL OVERVIEW
title: GENERAL OVERVIEW

c0: The Vehicle Modular Decontamination System (VMDS) is a modular, diesel-driven system
content: The Vehicle Modular Decontamination System (VMDS) is a modular, diesel-driven system

c0: specifically designed for rapid, mobile decontamination missions for terrain and military
content: specifically designed for rapid, mobile decontamination missions for terrain and military
equipment. This system is designed to be operated while mounted in the back of a vehicle or on a
trailer, while stationary or mobile.

c0: The VMDS Power Unit uses a Diesel engine-powered air compressor to provide energy to create
content: The VMDS Power Unit uses a Diesel engine-powered air compressor to provide energy to create

c0: and propel decontamination solutions through a 1 ½-inch (3.81 cm) pump.
content: and propel decontamination solutions through a 1 ½-inch (3.81 cm) pump. It deploys these

c0: solutions through vehicle- or trailer-mounted spray bars, a remote-control stanchion-mounted
content: solutions through vehicle- or trailer-mounted spray bars, a remote-control stanchion-mounted

c0: monitor (water cannon) and non-collapsible hoses with D-bale handset(s). The VMDS is capable
content: monitor (water cannon) and non-collapsible hoses with D-bale handset(s). The VMDS is capable

c0: of drafting from external water sources such as bulk tanks or natural water sources.
content: of drafting from external water sources such as bulk tanks or natural water sources. In addition to

c0: the Power Unit, the VMDS incorporates two solution-mixing tanks with fill capacities of 750
content: the Power Unit, the VMDS incorporates two solution-mixing tanks with fill capacities of 750
gallons each tank. Tanks are constructed with internal baffles to minimize liquid movement and
weight shift during transport.

c0: The VMDS can deploy decontamination solutions in three forms: liquid, foam, and slurry.
content: The VMDS can deploy decontamination solutions in three forms: liquid, foam, and slurry.
Liquid – Non-expanded (1:1 expansion ratio) – no addition of air into the stream.
Compressed Air Foam (CAF) - Expanded (up to ~20:1 air to liquid ratio) which is generated by

c0: on board air injection into the liquid solution.
content: on board air injection into the liquid solution. This expansion rate can be realized when using

c0: surfactant-based decontaminant solutions.  CAF is activated using the air control valve on the front
content: surfactant-based decontaminant solutions.  CAF is activated using the air control valve on the front
panel of the Power Unit.
Slurry – Non-expanded, highly concentrated solution that is applied in a thick, cake-batter like
consistency.
ADDITIONAL SYSTEM PERFORMANCE CHARACTERISTICS:
Expansion: 1:1 (liquid application) to ~20:1(CAF application)
Output Stream: 90-95 gpm

c0: Output Throw Distance: Up to ~90 ft (Dependent upon user settings, decontaminant
content: Output Throw Distance: Up to ~90 ft (Dependent upon user settings, decontaminant

c0: or foaming product, nozzle, wind and other factors)
content: or foaming product, nozzle, wind and other factors)

c0: Zero-Prime Drafting: Up to ~20 ft. vertical lift
content: Zero-Prime Drafting: Up to ~20 ft. vertical lift

c0: Hydrant Fill Capability:  Yes (Directly into tank, not via DRAFT mode)
content: Hydrant Fill Capability:  Yes (Directly into tank, not via DRAFT mode)
